katersrichmond: I’ve just finished a period of 14 days self-isolating in my room (I live in a flat share so I wasn’t allowed into the rest of the house) and I found that getting dressed into proper clothes (not just loungewear) and opening the windows wide in my room every morning really helped me feel better. Also, keeping my space well organised, like all my food supplies in one corner, my books in another - I think this is important for anyone who has to isolate in a small space like a bedroom or studio apartment. And yes, try to avoid too much news! I went outside for the first time yesterday and the post-apocalyptic scenes that I’d cooked up in my head after two weeks of twitter and constant news scrolling was not the reality. The streets were quiet and some shop shelves were empty, sure, but it wasn’t end of the world territory. I think that’s incredibly important to remember if you’re prone to catastrophising.
